page.title: 11INDUSTRY IN THE CH'BURN AREA
page.content: Apart from agriculture,industry in the area is confined to 4 small sites. 1)TRUTEX LTD.,at Grindleton.This comp- any is part of the Tootal Group.It sells childrenÂ£s school\leisurewear clothing mainly through retail outlets and large contract customers such as British Home Stores.No actual manufac- ture takes place at Grin'ton which serves as an admin.centre.Approx.60 staff are employed on the site.2)Pendle makesÂ£Berber'carpets at W.Bradford in an old weaving shed.20 people are em- ployed.3)Stonebridge Mill at Ch'burn is part of the Smith and Nephew group.140 people are employed weaving:-a)Cotton fabrics to be made up into garments.b) Fabrics for the surgical dressings industry.4)TUFF-LINK.This is an inde- pendent company in Ch'burn making nylon\PVC chains for the garden trade. 50 people are employed.
